diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Infection due to viable Staphylococcus aureus biofilms in total joint arthroplasty
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was supported by confocal microscopy, which revealed viable Staphylococcus aureus bacteria in biofilm aggregates, and reverse transcriptase-polymerase chain reaction analysis confirmed the presence of metabolically active Staphylococcus aureus. This provided compelling evidence of persistent infection despite multiple negative cultures.
